image.altText: a map of Victoria with Melbourne, Falls Creek, and Nelse listed on it.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed they have located two women dead at Nelse, near Falls Creek in Victoria's alpine area.Â

title.children: Two women found dead near remote Victorian alpine hut

image.altText: Two smiling Carlton players stand on the field with their arms around each other's shoulders after a game.

props.synopsis: Clubs move to formalise deals as the free agency period gets underway, while a series of big names could be on the move in next week's trade period.

title.children: Saints win big with Blues duo as AFL free agency begins

image.altText: Alex in a suit standing in a field at a press conference with microphones.

props.synopsis: Leading members of Australian Jewish communities are reeling after a fatal attack at a synagogue in the UK on the holy day of Yom Kippur.

title.children: 'Our fears are justified': Australia's Jewish community mourns UK attack

image.altText: A bald man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue tie walks along a street with tv cameras surrounding him.

props.synopsis: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

title.children: Tony Mokbel cleared of some drug trafficking charges

image.altText: A stormwater drain

props.synopsis: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

title.children: New Melbourne flood mapping sparks outrage from inner-city council

image.altText: A line of cars behind a truck in Wodonga.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old girl has died in a crash involving an allegedly stolen car in Wodonga, as police investigate two deadly collisions in Victoria's north in the space of 12 hours.

title.children: Teenage girl dies in crash involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: A pothole on a road in the foreground and three cars drive in the background  on roads.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information laws show the majority of claims for compensation by drivers encountering hazards on Victorian roads are being rejected.

title.children: Just 1 per cent of state's road damage compensation claims approved

image.altText: Fairy lights glow from behind plastic sheets on a building that says "Punka Pub" at dusk.

props.synopsis: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they have yet to receive the government support they were promised.Â

title.children: As the Dezi Freeman manhunt drags on, so do the dark days in Porepunkah

image.altText: An aerial photo of a crane lifting a train carriage off a section of curved track.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne passenger train that derailed earlier in the year was travelling on a set of tracks that had been upgraded just days earlier, a preliminary report into the incident has found.

title.children: Derailed train travelling on recently upgraded tracks, report finds

image.altText: A shirt and singlet hanging next to each other in muted colour tones. Both look soft to touch.

props.synopsis: Scientists, farmers and the fashion industry collaborate to create a natural fabric that is both woven and knitted, low on emissions and set to shake up how we think about clothing.

title.children: 'Something lovely' emerges from exciting Australian textile experiment

image.altText: Coaches

props.synopsis: Craig Bellamy and Michael Maguire know each other better than most NRL coaches, and that familiarity will play a major part in how they tackle the NRL grand final.

title.children: How two old footy heads will battle it out via mind games and magic

image.altText: Hawthorn players celebrate by tipping their water bottles onto a teammate in the middle of a huddle

props.synopsis: Hawthorn posts a third consecutive AFLW victory to boost its top-four hopes, outlasting Fremantle in cold and windy conditions in Frankston.

title.children: Hawks prove AFLW top-four credentials with tough win over Freo

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett's speech after winning Essendon's best and fairest seems like a farewell, but it will be up to the Bombers as to whether the captain is allowed to leave the club in the AFL trade period.

title.children: Merrett's future in Bombers' hands despite star's apparent farewell

image.altText: A brown bug with vivid red and blue stripes on its abdomen.

props.synopsis: Whether you love beetles or the giant mantis it's time to cast your vote for Australia's top insect.

title.children: Vote for your favourite Australian Insect of the Year

image.altText: A nurse sitting behind a thin green curtain in a busy emergency department.

props.synopsis: An increase in mental health and drug-related emergencies puts strain on Bendigo hospital's emergency department, prompting calls for a dedicated treatment hub.Â

title.children: Regional nurses under pressure as mental health emergencies climb

image.altText: Stefano Utoikamanu looks to pass the ball to his left for the Storm during the 2025 NRL season.

props.synopsis: The mind games continue in the build-up to Sunday's season decider, with the Broncos reacting to Storm front-rower Stefano Utoikamanu's sledge earlier this week.

title.children: Broncos respond to Storm star's 'stuck up' barb ahead of NRL grand final

image.altText: Clayton Oliver stands with his hands on his head after a 2025 AFL match.

props.synopsis: Clayton Oliver appears set to leave Melbourne after the Demons reveal they will not stand in his way if he wants to consider a trade to another club.Â

title.children: Demons happy for Oliver to 'explore his options' in AFL trade period

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with brown hair with her hand holding a tissue in front of her face.

props.synopsis: The 51-year-old's lawyer says she will appeal a jury verdict that found her guilty of three murders and attempted murder.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson to appeal guilty verdicts

image.altText: A double-storey white church building sits behind a green fence.

props.synopsis: Multiple investigations are examining a Victorian church's response to an assault committed by a senior pastor's son, amid allegations that information was withheld from the church community.

title.children: Church under investigation after pastor's son sexually assaulted teen

image.altText: A close-up of the Qantas logo on the tail of one of its planes. The sky behind it is clear.

props.synopsis: Regional politicians unanimously condemn Qantas over the impending closure of its Mildura crew base, saying it underscores the city's vulnerability to the "whims" of private transport companies.

title.children: Qantas staff base closure labelled a 'slap in the face' for Mildura

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young boys farewelling a group of adults.

props.synopsis: Men sent to Victoria's Dhurringile mansion and farm from the British care system as children form a friendship lasting six decades.

title.children: Child migrants sent to Australia after WWII form bonds for life

image.altText: A man sitting outside.

props.synopsis: Luke Filby remembers looking up to his uncle Dezi, right up until the point he didn't. And he's not alone in having stepped away before the killing of two police officers.

title.children: Former friends and family paint portrait of alleged cop killer Dezi Freeman

image.altText: Two images showing men in costumes.

props.synopsis: Geelong breaks its silence about the club's Mad Monday antics, revealing future post-season events "will not continue in this current form".Â

title.children: Cats apologise for 'inappropriate' Mad Monday, AFL 'not thrilled'

image.altText: Four young women from Afghanistan are wearing white shirts and jumping in the air cheering.

props.synopsis: Australian-based players headline the Afghan women's refugee football team preparing to play for the first time since the Taliban takeover in 2021, but they're still pushing for greater autonomy over their future.

title.children: After years in exile, Afghan refugees to re-enter international football

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: A months-long investigation by the Australian Communications and Media Authority finds seven breaches of decency rules between August and December last year.

title.children: Watchdog threatens radio network over 'vulgar' Kyle and Jackie O Show

image.altText: A main street lined with shops and parked cars.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest retail drinks network has been knocked back for a second time in its legal bid to open a liquor store in the heart of Daylesford.

title.children: Small town wins three-year legal fight against liquor retail giant

image.altText: A large group of people, most dressed in black, stand together in a suburban area beneath a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Friends and family have gathered in Victoria's east to remember the life of a beloved young man who died in an alleged attack on the weekend.

title.children: Hundreds pay respects to young, 'generational leader' after alleged murder

image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: The closure of the three bases will take effect in 2026 and affect about 70 personnel, who will be supported throughout the process, the airline said.

title.children: Qantas to close staff bases in Canberra, Hobart and Mildura

image.altText: An umpire bounces a ball before an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The AFL will no longer have the traditional bouncedown to start men's games, and has also ditched the controversial sub rule.

title.children: After more than a century, the centre bounce is no more in the AFL

image.altText: Jeff Schoep sitting in Chesterfield chair.

props.synopsis: Former US Neo-Nazi leader Jeff Schoep urges the Australian media not to publicise the actions of Neo-Nazis, after attending protests to gain insights into extremism in Victoria.

title.children: American ex-Neo-Nazi takes 'peace building' mission to Victoria

image.altText: A fallen tree in a field near a rest stop where articulated trucks can be seen.

props.synopsis: The truck smashed into two trucks parked on the Hume Freeway near Wangaratta and caught fire.

title.children: Fiery crash into parked trucks on Hume Freeway leaves driver dead

image.altText: Bailey Smith and Harris Andrews clash in the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday â now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

title.children: How two Instagram posts have unravelled years of goodwill at Geelong's Mad Monday

image.altText: A woman holds a glass wine bottle and aluminum bottle side by side

props.synopsis: A Victorian company releases Australia's first aluminium wine bottles to reduce its carbon footprint, while acknowledging drinkers may take some convincing.Â

title.children: Winery sells country's first drop in an aluminium bottle to cut emissions

image.altText: Court sketch of accused truck driver Brett Michael Russell

props.synopsis: Brett Michael Russell was driving a truck that hit a school bus north-west of Melbourne in 2022, leaving some students and staff with life-changing injuries.

title.children: Truck driver who hit school bus knew he had faulty brakes, court told

image.altText: A tabby kitten claws and bites a toy while sitting on an office desk.

props.synopsis: A playful tabby kitten and a ravenous Muscovy duck routinely amuse council staff in their respective workplaces.

title.children: Meet the tip cat and the depot duck boosting workplace morale
